Matt the bartender is soooo attentive and helpful, he really completes the amazing customer service!! Its also really cool that they provide Free poker on Thursday nights with specials. Thats awesome!!

So a small error was made in the event my debit card was accidentally given away to another patron, nightmare! However I was incredibly impressed how the situation was handled. Not only was my bar tab taken care of, Michael Kogan also gave me as well as my friends drinks as well as paying for an uber to go pick up my debit card from another bar and return it back to me before I left. In my opinion this is the epitome of customer service! So thankful the mistake was not only corrected but to feel like he really cared about returning my lost item. Fellow service industry worker approved.

I used to love this place until the bartender  tonight called me a bitch. I cracked a joke and he told me I was a bitch and we wouldn't serve me. He proceeded to pour himself drinks and chat it up with his buddies all night and no longer serve the bar after the moment we got there. I will no longer come back considering the amount of disrespect I received tonight.

We saw this newer place open a while back and gave it a shot.  It seemed like this place has too much space for what they are trying to do...it is really kind of random.  There are games thrown all around with little keep up.

The vibe is a mix between D&Bs and a scottsdale nightclub.  We hung out outside on the patio and were able to have a good time taking this place in while hanging out with our group. The beers aren't too bad, they have a nice selection and you get quite the glass.

If we stumbled in here again I wouldn't be mad, just indifferent, this place is meh.

I didn't know bars still allowed smoking in the main areas....what??

Tried to visit this Patio & Grill with my family including my sister who's currently pregnant and we had to leave immediately. 

Disappointed that it wasn't listed anywhere that there was smoking inside.

To be fair this is more of a 3.5 with serious potential. The atmosphere is great... Ping pong, corn hole, pool table, darts and music all make for a great time! The menu isn't bad either. I've had the chopped salad, grilled cheese bites, "free bird" chicken entree and the nachos. All great bar food! The problems: The wait time for food (I've been a few times now and waited 30+ minutes every time). The service in general is slow but this place is brand new and I don't see these issues being permanent. All in all it's a really fun place to hang out!

Really nice to find a bar with people country dancing in old town. I went on a Wednesday night and it was surprisingly busy. They played country music 95% of the time, and they had entertaining dancing contests that kept me entertained. My friends all had a nice time.

This bar has the feel of a tailgate party. The majority of the bar activity occurs in is large, mostly uncovered patio. It has cornhole and other outdoor games and a huge outdoor projection screen for game watching. It gets particularly busy on Friday nights with mostly a 20/30s crowd. My only real compliant is that for a relaxed, outside of the main Old Town bar loop, they still charge a premium drink price.

I'm not much of an Old Town Scottsdale guy....at all...except when I have to watch a Basketball game at the depressing Majerle's becuase I don't have a TV at home.  Somehow I stumbled upon Boondocks which has formerly been many a bars.  

This place is such a surprise.  If you can get past what I call the "Celebrity Service" (Celebrity Service = when the servers think they are celebrities and care more about talking about themselves and what they look like than caring about the people they are serving), you have a winner.  

The atmosphere/games are bad ass.  It's very large and spread out.  Clean. And the food was pure shock and awe for me.  From the Moink Burger (maybe my favorite burger in town) to the Carnitas Tacos  to even the Broccoli appetizer....all winners!! 

Thank you for this place!!!
